channel.title: AOPA Live This Week
channel.description: Weekly update of general aviation news from the Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
channel.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
channel.itunes:keywords: aviation flying pilot aircraft FAA AOPA planes
channel.itunes:subtitle: General aviation news
channel.itunes:summary: Weekly update of general aviation news from the Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - August 14, 2014
item.description: We check out the One Week Wonder - a homebuilt, built in a week. Flying the Boeing that started it all - the Boeing 40. We remember Robin Williams' AOPA moment.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - August 14, 2014
item.media:description: We check out the One Week Wonder - a homebuilt, built in a week. Flying the Boeing that started it all - the Boeing 40. We remember Robin Williams' AOPA moment.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: We check out the One Week Wonder - a homebuilt, built in a week. Flying the Boeing that started it all - the Boeing 40. We remember Robin Williams' AOPA moment.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - August 7, 2014
item.description: NTSB doesn't like medical certificate reform. Go flying with Sean D. Tucker over Oshkosh. Paul Poberezny and the Baby Ace - the plane that started a movement, and inside aircraft modifier Rocket Engineering.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - August 7, 2014
item.media:description: NTSB doesn't like medical certificate reform. Go flying with Sean D. Tucker over Oshkosh. Paul Poberezny and the Baby Ace - the plane that started a movement, and inside aircraft modifier Rocket Engineering.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: NTSB doesn't like medical certificate reform. Go flying with Sean D. Tucker over Oshkosh. Paul Poberezny and the Baby Ace - the plane that started a movement, and inside aircraft modifier Rocket Engineering.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - August 1, 2014 - AirVenture Friday
item.description: The FAA reports on medical certificate reform. A seaplane adventure in Lake Winnebago. Helping women soar, and an inspiring flight. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - August 1, 2014 - AirVenture Friday
item.media:description: The FAA reports on medical certificate reform. A seaplane adventure in Lake Winnebago. Helping women soar, and an inspiring flight. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: The FAA reports on medical certificate reform. A seaplane adventure in Lake Winnebago. Helping women soar, and an inspiring flight. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 - Thursday
item.description: AOPA details it programs for affordable flying. A jet-fuel Skyhawk. A first-timer tries to take in all of Oshkosh. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 - Thursday
item.media:description: AOPA details it programs for affordable flying. A jet-fuel Skyhawk. A first-timer tries to take in all of Oshkosh. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: AOPA details it programs for affordable flying. A jet-fuel Skyhawk. A first-timer tries to take in all of Oshkosh. AOPA Live This Week from AirVenture 2014 in Oshkosh.

item.title: C152 Reimagined
item.description: AOPA tests new ways to open door to aviation with "Reimagined Aircraft" such as a Cessna 152 that can be co-owned and operated for as little as $65/hour, including fuel.
item.media:title: C152 Reimagined
item.media:description: AOPA tests new ways to open door to aviation with "Reimagined Aircraft" such as a Cessna 152 that can be co-owned and operated for as little as $65/hour, including fuel.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: AOPA tests new ways to open door to aviation with "Reimagined Aircraft" such as a Cessna 152 that can be co-owned and operated for as little as $65/hour, including fuel.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - July 24, 2014
item.description: FAA Administrator Michael Huerta visits AOPA and is speaking out about third class medical reform. We fly with Patty Wagstaff in Kenya, and we fly the PBY-5A Catalina. Its an unsung hero of WWII.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - July 24, 2014
item.media:description: FAA Administrator Michael Huerta visits AOPA and is speaking out about third class medical reform. We fly with Patty Wagstaff in Kenya, and we fly the PBY-5A Catalina. Its an unsung hero of WWII.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: FAA Administrator Michael Huerta visits AOPA and is speaking out about third class medical reform. We fly with Patty Wagstaff in Kenya, and we fly the PBY-5A Catalina. Its an unsung hero of WWII.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - July 17, 2014
item.description: New midget personal jet from Sonex flies, even does aerobatics on its first flight. Time is getting close to award the AOPA Sweepstakes Debonair; see how your airplane looks over the Big Apple. We have an update on the search for a replacement for 100LL, and it’s good news. And we take a look at the army of green shirts that help make the AOPA Regional Fly-Ins possible.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - July 17, 2014
item.media:description: New midget personal jet from Sonex flies, even does aerobatics on its first flight. Time is getting close to award the AOPA Sweepstakes Debonair; see how your airplane looks over the Big Apple. We have an update on the search for a replacement for 100LL, and it’s good news. And we take a look at the army of green shirts that help make the AOPA Regional Fly-Ins possible.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: New midget personal jet from Sonex flies, even does aerobatics on its first flight. Time is getting close to award the AOPA Sweepstakes Debonair; see how your airplane looks over the Big Apple. We have an update on the search for a replacement for 100LL, and it’s good news. And we take a look at the army of green shirts that help make the AOPA Regional Fly-Ins possible.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - July 10, 2014
item.description: A runway incursion in Barcelona, Spain, got plenty of media attention, though it may not have been quite as hairy as some would have you think. We’ll chat with AOPA Foundation President Bruce Landsberg about the lessons, including “look both ways.” Plus, we’ll take you to Plymouth, Massachusetts for a look at what makes it a perfect place for an AOPA Fly-In, and return to San Marcos, Texas, for some unconventional taxi lessons.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - July 10, 2014
item.media:description: A runway incursion in Barcelona, Spain, got plenty of media attention, though it may not have been quite as hairy as some would have you think. We’ll chat with AOPA Foundation President Bruce Landsberg about the lessons, including “look both ways.” Plus, we’ll take you to Plymouth, Massachusetts for a look at what makes it a perfect place for an AOPA Fly-In, and return to San Marcos, Texas, for some unconventional taxi lessons.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: A runway incursion in Barcelona, Spain, got plenty of media attention, though it may not have been quite as hairy as some would have you think. We’ll chat with AOPA Foundation President Bruce Landsberg about the lessons, including “look both ways.” Plus, we’ll take you to Plymouth, Massachusetts for a look at what makes it a perfect place for an AOPA Fly-In, and return to San Marcos, Texas, for some unconventional taxi lessons.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - July 3, 2014
item.description: Fly along with us as Snoopy 2 tucks in “tight” on Snoopy 1. Find out what it’s like to fly a blimp. We visit a New England airport restaurant with chowder worth the flight. Updates on the avgas and medical certificate issues, and a tribute to your freedom to fly.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - July 3, 2014
item.media:description: Fly along with us as Snoopy 2 tucks in “tight” on Snoopy 1. Find out what it’s like to fly a blimp. We visit a New England airport restaurant with chowder worth the flight. Updates on the avgas and medical certificate issues, and a tribute to your freedom to fly.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: Fly along with us as Snoopy 2 tucks in “tight” on Snoopy 1. Find out what it’s like to fly a blimp. We visit a New England airport restaurant with chowder worth the flight. Updates on the avgas and medical certificate issues, and a tribute to your freedom to fly.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - June 26, 2014
item.description: We fly the Howard 500. The breakfast bunch flies a C-45 named Chow Hound. The USA Today debacle continues. The National Park Service clamps down on drones.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - June 26, 2014
item.media:description: We fly the Howard 500. The breakfast bunch flies a C-45 named Chow Hound. The USA Today debacle continues. The National Park Service clamps down on drones.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: We fly the Howard 500. The breakfast bunch flies a C-45 named Chow Hound. The USA Today debacle continues. The National Park Service clamps down on drones.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - June 19, 2014
item.description: AOPA answers egregious USA Today series on GA safety. The Sweepstakes Debonair is done! A look at what might be your airplane. Dog fighting over Cape Cod, and the Special Olympics airlift.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - June 19, 2014
item.media:description: AOPA answers egregious USA Today series on GA safety. The Sweepstakes Debonair is done! A look at what might be your airplane. Dog fighting over Cape Cod, and the Special Olympics airlift.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: AOPA answers egregious USA Today series on GA safety. The Sweepstakes Debonair is done! A look at what might be your airplane. Dog fighting over Cape Cod, and the Special Olympics airlift.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - June 12, 2014
item.description: Fly with us across the Atlantic in a TBM 900. Join us for the adventure. We travel to AOPA's birthplace to celebrate 75 years. Find out how a glider club is soaring to new heights as an airport owner.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - June 12, 2014
item.media:description: Fly with us across the Atlantic in a TBM 900. Join us for the adventure. We travel to AOPA's birthplace to celebrate 75 years. Find out how a glider club is soaring to new heights as an airport owner.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: Fly with us across the Atlantic in a TBM 900. Join us for the adventure. We travel to AOPA's birthplace to celebrate 75 years. Find out how a glider club is soaring to new heights as an airport owner.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - June 5, 2014
item.description: Super Cub number 1, restored by two master craftsman. First flight of Solar Impulse Two. The FBI is on the trail of criminals with lasers lighting up aircraft. The latest on NextGen.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - June 5, 2014
item.media:description: Super Cub number 1, restored by two master craftsman. First flight of Solar Impulse Two. The FBI is on the trail of criminals with lasers lighting up aircraft. The latest on NextGen.

item.itunes:summary: Super Cub number 1, restored by two master craftsman. First flight of Solar Impulse Two. The FBI is on the trail of criminals with lasers lighting up aircraft. The latest on NextGen.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - May 29, 2014
item.description: Get behind the controls of an Eclipse 550 with AOPA Editor in Chief Tom Haines, find out how pressure from pilots led Customs and Border Protection to rethink its warrantless stops and searches of general aviation aircraft, and meet three generations of women pilots.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - May 29, 2014
item.media:description: Get behind the controls of an Eclipse 550 with AOPA Editor in Chief Tom Haines, find out how pressure from pilots led Customs and Border Protection to rethink its warrantless stops and searches of general aviation aircraft, and meet three generations of women pilots.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: Get behind the controls of an Eclipse 550 with AOPA Editor in Chief Tom Haines, find out how pressure from pilots led Customs and Border Protection to rethink its warrantless stops and searches of general aviation aircraft, and meet three generations of women pilots.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - May 22, 2014
item.description: AOPA helps grounded aircraft back into the air. A look at a rare warbird that you can see at the AOPA Indianapolis Fly-In May 31. A supersonic business jet.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - May 22, 2014
item.media:description: AOPA helps grounded aircraft back into the air. A look at a rare warbird that you can see at the AOPA Indianapolis Fly-In May 31. A supersonic business jet.

item.itunes:summary: AOPA helps grounded aircraft back into the air. A look at a rare warbird that you can see at the AOPA Indianapolis Fly-In May 31. A supersonic business jet.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - May 15, 2014
item.description: Upset training in an L-39. Drones literally falling out of the sky and violating controlled airspace. A look at AOPA's beginnings 75 years ago, and a look forward. A pilot's restaurant with really hot stuff.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - May 15, 2014
item.media:description: Upset training in an L-39. Drones literally falling out of the sky and violating controlled airspace. A look at AOPA's beginnings 75 years ago, and a look forward. A pilot's restaurant with really hot stuff.

item.itunes:summary: Upset training in an L-39. Drones literally falling out of the sky and violating controlled airspace. A look at AOPA's beginnings 75 years ago, and a look forward. A pilot's restaurant with really hot stuff.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - May 8, 2014
item.description: Fly the Hudson River in New York City. The corridor lets you see NYC in a way like no other. Take an aerobatic ride from Billy Werth at the AOPA Indianapolis Regional Fly In.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - May 8, 2014
item.media:description: Fly the Hudson River in New York City. The corridor lets you see NYC in a way like no other. Take an aerobatic ride from Billy Werth at the AOPA Indianapolis Regional Fly In.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - May 1, 2014
item.description: More warrant-less stops of innocent pilots, but AOPA President Mark Baker goes right to the top for relief. AOPA's first regional Fly-In a huge success in Texas. First flight for the E-Fan.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - May 1, 2014
item.media:description: More warrant-less stops of innocent pilots, but AOPA President Mark Baker goes right to the top for relief. AOPA's first regional Fly-In a huge success in Texas. First flight for the E-Fan.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: More warrant-less stops of innocent pilots, but AOPA President Mark Baker goes right to the top for relief. AOPA's first regional Fly-In a huge success in Texas. First flight for the E-Fan.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - April 24, 2014
item.description: One AME says his 30 years of issuing third class medical certificates have done nothing to improve safety. Looking through the bottom of the aircraft with the most expensive flight helmet ever. Taking off from a dry runway in a straight float seaplane. How do they do it?
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - April 24, 2014
item.media:description: One AME says his 30 years of issuing third class medical certificates have done nothing to improve safety. Looking through the bottom of the aircraft with the most expensive flight helmet ever. Taking off from a dry runway in a straight float seaplane. How do they do it?

item.itunes:summary: One AME says his 30 years of issuing third class medical certificates have done nothing to improve safety. Looking through the bottom of the aircraft with the most expensive flight helmet ever. Taking off from a dry runway in a straight float seaplane. How do they do it?

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - April 17, 2014
item.description: The Los Angeles Times shines the light on Customs and Border Protection's actions against innocent pilots. The latest on the driver's license medical. Where warbirds come home to roost, and saving an airport.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - April 17, 2014
item.media:description: The Los Angeles Times shines the light on Customs and Border Protection's actions against innocent pilots. The latest on the driver's license medical. Where warbirds come home to roost, and saving an airport.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: The Los Angeles Times shines the light on Customs and Border Protection's actions against innocent pilots. The latest on the driver's license medical. Where warbirds come home to roost, and saving an airport.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - April 10, 2014
item.description: The ride of a lifetime in the Blue Angels' Fat Albert. A father and son team build the most beautiful Waco biplanes you've ever seen. GAO thinks the FAA's medical certification process could be better.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - April 10, 2014
item.media:description: The ride of a lifetime in the Blue Angels' Fat Albert. A father and son team build the most beautiful Waco biplanes you've ever seen. GAO thinks the FAA's medical certification process could be better.

item.itunes:summary: The ride of a lifetime in the Blue Angels' Fat Albert. A father and son team build the most beautiful Waco biplanes you've ever seen. GAO thinks the FAA's medical certification process could be better.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - April 3, 2014
item.description: A step closer to a driver's license medical. News from Sun 'n Fun 2014. New helicopter training device from Redbird. A turbine-powered RV-10. A sleek new speedster from Tecnam.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - April 3, 2014
item.media:description: A step closer to a driver's license medical. News from Sun 'n Fun 2014. New helicopter training device from Redbird. A turbine-powered RV-10. A sleek new speedster from Tecnam.

item.itunes:summary: A step closer to a driver's license medical. News from Sun 'n Fun 2014. New helicopter training device from Redbird. A turbine-powered RV-10. A sleek new speedster from Tecnam.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - March 27, 2014
item.description: Learn about the AOPA Rusty Pilots program - its geared at getting you back into the left seat. Fly the new engine in the Sweepstakes Debonair. Paul Harrop goes on a fantasy shopping trip for in flight entertainment options.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - March 27, 2014
item.media:description: Learn about the AOPA Rusty Pilots program - its geared at getting you back into the left seat. Fly the new engine in the Sweepstakes Debonair. Paul Harrop goes on a fantasy shopping trip for in flight entertainment options.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: Learn about the AOPA Rusty Pilots program - its geared at getting you back into the left seat. Fly the new engine in the Sweepstakes Debonair. Paul Harrop goes on a fantasy shopping trip for in flight entertainment options.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - March 20, 2014
item.description: A wrap up of news from AEA in Nashville. Hot new avionics including the Sandia SAI 340 Quattro, the Aspen Evolution VFR PFD and the Bendix King KLR-10. Plus we take a look at ADS-B questions. A world record 81 inverted flat spins.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - March 20, 2014
item.media:description: A wrap up of news from AEA in Nashville. Hot new avionics including the Sandia SAI 340 Quattro, the Aspen Evolution VFR PFD and the Bendix King KLR-10. Plus we take a look at ADS-B questions. A world record 81 inverted flat spins.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: A wrap up of news from AEA in Nashville. Hot new avionics including the Sandia SAI 340 Quattro, the Aspen Evolution VFR PFD and the Bendix King KLR-10. Plus we take a look at ADS-B questions. A world record 81 inverted flat spins.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - March 13, 2014
item.description: We're in Nashville for the Aircraft Electronics Association 2014 conference. There's a big step towards a DL medical. Check out an accident between a Cessna and a skydiver. AOPA launches a guide to starting a flying club. The Sweepstakes Debonair gets a new engine.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - March 13, 2014
item.media:description: We're in Nashville for the Aircraft Electronics Association 2014 conference. There's a big step towards a DL medical. Check out an accident between a Cessna and a skydiver. AOPA launches a guide to starting a flying club. The Sweepstakes Debonair gets a new engine.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: We're in Nashville for the Aircraft Electronics Association 2014 conference. There's a big step towards a DL medical. Check out an accident between a Cessna and a skydiver. AOPA launches a guide to starting a flying club. The Sweepstakes Debonair gets a new engine.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - March 6, 2014
item.description: They're back - user fees on general aviation, thanks to the White House. A safer way to make an approach to an oil rig on stormy seas. Women fly it forward to encourage more to become pilots.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - March 6, 2014
item.media:description: They're back - user fees on general aviation, thanks to the White House. A safer way to make an approach to an oil rig on stormy seas. Women fly it forward to encourage more to become pilots.
item.itunes:author: Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association
item.itunes:summary: They're back - user fees on general aviation, thanks to the White House. A safer way to make an approach to an oil rig on stormy seas. Women fly it forward to encourage more to become pilots.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - February 27, 2014
item.description: From Heli-Expo in Anaheim, California. A special tribute to aviation legend Bob Hoover. AOPA President Mark Baker says "we aren't going to take it anymore" about CBP stops of law-abiding pilots. A modern Jet Ranger is announced, and Enstrom has a new training helicopter.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - February 27, 2014
item.media:description: From Heli-Expo in Anaheim, California. A special tribute to aviation legend Bob Hoover. AOPA President Mark Baker says "we aren't going to take it anymore" about CBP stops of law-abiding pilots. A modern Jet Ranger is announced, and Enstrom has a new training helicopter.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - February 20, 2014
item.description: An update on the Cirrus Vision jet, the state of the general aviation industry according to GAMA, an historic 20 year anniversary.

item.media:description: An update on the Cirrus Vision jet, the state of the general aviation industry according to GAMA, an historic 20 year anniversary.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - February 13, 2014
item.description: AOPA teams up to fight the good fight over Santa Monica airport. Mooney is back, but the Cessna Skycatcher is gone. And what's a pig got to do with aviation?

item.media:description: AOPA teams up to fight the good fight over Santa Monica airport. Mooney is back, but the Cessna Skycatcher is gone. And what's a pig got to do with aviation?

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - February 6, 2014
item.description: Senator gets angry over Customs and Border Protection's stonewalling. A nifty little light sport aircraft with Italian flair. An aviation high school where it's cool to be smart.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - January 30, 2014
item.description: GA could be safer if the FAA changed the rules. An app to help you make the go/no go decision. The iceway is open, again, and the most famous airplane you've never heard of.

item.media:description: GA could be safer if the FAA changed the rules. An app to help you make the go/no go decision. The iceway is open, again, and the most famous airplane you've never heard of.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - January 23, 2014
item.description: AOPA Live This Week® showcases the strangest looking amphibious aircraft you've ever seen. Plus, take a look at the state of the light sport aircraft industry. Get details about an order a judge issued on Santa Monica Municipal Airport in southern California.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - January 23, 2014
item.media:description: AOPA Live This Week® showcases the strangest looking amphibious aircraft you've ever seen. Plus, take a look at the state of the light sport aircraft industry. Get details about an order a judge issued on Santa Monica Municipal Airport in southern California.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - January 16, 2014
item.description: General aviation on NTSB's list again. Flying the AOPA Sweepstakes Debonair. Progress towards a driver's license medical. Controlling an airplane with brain waves alone. A preview of the Sport Aviation Expo in Sebring.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - January 16, 2014
item.media:description: General aviation on NTSB's list again. Flying the AOPA Sweepstakes Debonair. Progress towards a driver's license medical. Controlling an airplane with brain waves alone. A preview of the Sport Aviation Expo in Sebring.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - January 9, 2014
item.description: AOPA President Mark Baker announces new regional Fly-Ins and the return of the AOPA Headquarters Fly-In. A look at rare craftsmanship in restoring classic aircraft. Big changes at the world's oldest airport.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - January 9, 2014
item.media:description: AOPA President Mark Baker announces new regional Fly-Ins and the return of the AOPA Headquarters Fly-In. A look at rare craftsmanship in restoring classic aircraft. Big changes at the world's oldest airport.

item.title: AOPA Fly-Ins - Mark Baker
item.description: AOPA announces six regional AOPA Fly-Ins for 2014, and the AOPA Homecoming Fly-In at the association's Frederick, MD (FDK) headquaters to mark AOPA's 75th anniversary.
item.media:title: AOPA Fly-Ins - Mark Baker
item.media:description: AOPA announces six regional AOPA Fly-Ins for 2014, and the AOPA Homecoming Fly-In at the association's Frederick, MD (FDK) headquaters to mark AOPA's 75th anniversary.

item.title: AOPA Live This Week - The Directors Cut 2013
item.description: Its the best of best, a look back at the stories that stood out in 2013. Join the show's producers for the insider scoop on the stories that got you talking. Plus, we take a look back at the top news headlines in the GA world this year.
item.media:title: AOPA Live This Week - The Directors Cut 2013
